data.enText: having a lot of money or property

data.chText: 世界上最富有的女人之一
data.enText: one of the richest women in the world

data.chText: 如今没有人能靠写作致富。
data.enText: Nobody gets rich from writing nowadays.
people who have a lot of money or property

data.chText: 这是富人和名流最喜欢去度假的地方。
data.enText: It's a favourite resort for the rich and famous.
producing a lot of wealth so that many of its people can live at a high standard

data.chText: 最富有的国家 / 经济体 / 国家
非常有趣的；丰富多彩的
data.enText: very interesting and full of variety

data.chText: 这个地区丰富多彩的历史和文化
data.enText: the region's rich history and culture

data.chText: 她过着丰富多彩的生活。
data.enText: She leads a rich and varied life.
containing or providing a large supply of sth

data.chText: 橘子含有丰富的维生素C。
data.enText: Oranges are rich in vitamin C.

data.chText: 这个地区的野生动植物很多。
data.enText: The area is rich in wildlife.

data.chText: 他的小说为电影业提供了大量素材。
data.enText: His novels are a rich source of material for the movie industry.
containing a lot of fat, butter, eggs, etc. and making you feel full quickly
containing the substances that make it good for growing plants in

data.chText: 强烈的；深的；低沉的；美好的；宜人的

before.enText: of colours, sounds, smells and tastes

data.enText: strong or deep; very beautiful or pleasing

data.chText: 这些屋子装饰着华丽昂贵的织物。
data.enText: The rooms were decorated with rich fabrics.

data.chText: （表示某人所作的批评是无稽之谈，因为他们本身也存在同样的问题）
data.enText: used to say that a criticism sb makes is surprising and not reasonable, because they have the same fault

data.chText: 我？懒？你这么说，实在可笑！
data.enText: Me? Lazy? That's rich, coming from you!
to get a lot of money, especially suddenly or unexpectedly

data.text: rich ♦ wealthy ♦ prosperous ♦ affluent ♦ well off ♦ comfortable

data.chText: 以上各词均用以形容人富有或地方富饶。
data.enText: These words all describe sb/sth that has a lot of money, property or valuable possessions.

data.chText: 指（人）富有的、富裕的，（国家或城市）富庶的、富饶的
data.enText: (of a person) having a lot of money, property or valuable possessions; (of a country or city) producing a lot of wealth so that many of its people can live at a high standard

data.chText: 上述两词在意义上无实质性区别，两词均很常用，不过rich更常用，并用于一些固定短语中，wealthy则不能：
data.enText: There is no real difference in meaning between these two words. Both are very frequent, but rich is more frequent and occurs in some fixed phrases where wealthy cannot.
It's a favourite resort for the wealthy and famous.

data.chText: 指繁荣的、成功的、兴旺的

data.enText: ( rather formal ) rich and with a good standard of living

data.chText: prosperous和affluent均用以指人和地方。prosperous较affluent更常用以指时期或时代。affluent常用于人或社会的贫富对比，prosperous几乎总是被视为好事：
data.enText: Both prosperous and affluent are used to talk about people and places. Prosperous is used much more than affluent to talk about times and periods. Affluent is often used to contrast rich people or societies with poor ones. Being prosperous is nearly always seen as a good thing.

data.chText: 看到你成功的样子真是令人高兴。
data.enText: It's good to see you looking so prosperous.
It's good to see you looking so affluent.

data.chText: （常用于否定句中）指富裕、有钱：

data.enText: His family is not very well off.

data.chText: well off的反义词为badly off，但不常用；指人不宽裕较常用not well off。
data.enText: The opposite of well off is badly off , but this is not very frequent; it is more common to say that sb is not well off .
having enough money to buy what you want without worrying about the cost

data.chText: 他们不是百万富翁，但也很富裕。
data.enText: They're not millionaires, but they're certainly very comfortable.

ex.chText: 他找了一个有钱的老婆。
ex.enText: He found himself a rich wife.

ex.chText: 世界上哪10个国家最富有？
ex.enText: What are the top 10 richest countries in the world?

synonyms.bx: 指拥有大量金钱及财产、超出生活实际需要的。

ex.chText: 他们决定搬到伦敦的一个富人区。
ex.enText: They decided to move to a wealthy suburb of London.

ex.chText: 他30多岁时成为一名富有的实业家。
ex.enText: He became a wealthy businessman in his thirties.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，多指经济上富裕且很有身份的。

ex.enText: There is plentiful rainfall in the regions where rice is grown.

ex.chText: 将从书本上学来的知识付诸实践的机会很多。
ex.enText: Opportunities to practice what has been learned from books are plentiful.

ex.chText: 你确定那座小岛上有充足的淡水供应吗？
ex.enText: Are you sure there is an abundant/a plentiful supply of fresh water on that island?

ex.chText: 该公司为有海外留学经历的员工提供大量升职机会。
ex.enText: That company provides abundant/plentiful promotion opportunities for staff with overseas education experience.

ex.chText: 有足够的证据表明全球气候正在变暖。
ex.enText: There is ample evidence that global climate is getting warmer.

ex.chText: 他发现房间里有足够的空间摆放他的书架和床。
ex.enText: He found ample space for his bookshelf and bed in the room.

ex.chText: 稍后你们会有充裕的时间和格林先生交谈。
ex.enText: You'll have ample time to talk with Mr. Green later.

synonyms.bx: 指足够满足需要或超过所需之量的。

ex.chText: 儿童应该吃富含营养的食物。

ex.enText: Spinach is a rich source of iron.

ex.chText: 哪些水果维生素C含量丰富？
ex.enText: What fruits are rich in vitamin C?

synonyms.bx: 指大量含有某物的，常用以构成复合词。

data.enText: to get a lot of money, especially suddenly or unexpectedly

tr: people who have possessions and wealth (considered as a group)
example: only the very rich benefit from this legislation
had ample food for the party
many fond hopes are pinned on rich uncles

tr: having an abundant supply of desirable qualities or substances (especially natural resources)
example: blessed with a land rich in minerals

tr: suggestive of or characterized by great expense
having a high proportion of fuel to air
example: a rich vein of copper", "a rich gas mixture

tr: marked by richness and fullness of flavor
example: the robust flavor of fresh-brewed coffee

tr: containing plenty of fat, or eggs, or sugar
example: they kept gorging on rich foods

value.def: A rich person has a lot of money or valuable possessions.

example.ex: You're going to be a very rich man...
example.tran: 你将会成为一个非常有钱的人。

example.ex: Their one aim in life is to get rich...
example.tran: 他们人生的一个目标就是要变成有钱人。

example.ex: With nothing but his own talent, he made himself rich and famous.
example.tran: 他一无所有，仅靠自身才能就变得富有而出名。

example.ex: This is a system in which the rich are cared for and the poor are left to suffer...
example.tran: 在这种制度之下，富人备受关照而穷人却受苦受难。

example.ex: Only the very rich have really benefited.
example.tran: 只有非常有钱的人才真正受益了。

example.ex: ...a gossip page featuring the rich and famous.
example.tran: 关注富人和名人的八卦版

value.def: Riches are valuable possessions or large amounts of money.

example.ex: An Olympic gold medal can lead to untold riches for an athlete...
example.tran: 一枚奥运金牌能给运动员带来无尽的财富。

example.ex: Some people want fame or riches — I just wanted a baby.
example.tran: 有人希望得到名望，有人希望获得财富——我只想要个孩子。

value.def: A rich country has a strong economy and produces a lot of wealth, so many people who live there have a high standard of living.

example.ex: There is hunger in many parts of the world, even in rich countries.
example.tran: 世界上很多地方，甚至在富有的国家里，都有人忍饥挨饿。

value.def: If you talk about the earth's riches, you are referring to things that exist naturally in large quantities and that are useful and valuable, for example minerals, wood, and oil.

example.ex: ...Russia's vast natural riches.
example.tran: 俄罗斯丰富的自然资源

example.ex: ...the oil riches of the Middle East.
example.tran: 中东的石油资源

value.def: If something is rich in a useful or valuable substance or is a rich source of it, it contains a lot of it.

example.ex: Liver and kidney are particularly rich in vitamin A...
example.tran: 肝脏和肾脏的维生素A含量尤其丰富。

example.ex: Fish is a rich source of protein.
example.tran: 鱼肉富含蛋白质。

value.def: Rich food contains a lot of fat or oil.

example.ex: ...the hearty, rich foods of Gascony...
example.tran: 加斯科涅丰盛而油腻的食物

example.ex: Additional cream would make it too rich.
example.tran: 再加奶油会让它过于油腻。

example.ex: The coffee flavour complemented the richness of the pudding.
example.tran: 咖啡的味道中和了布丁的油腻感。

value.def: Rich soil contains large amounts of substances that make it good for growing crops or flowers in.

example.ex: Farmers grow rice in the rich soil.
example.tran: 农民们在肥沃的土地上种植稻子。

value.def: A rich deposit of a mineral or other substance is a large amount of it.

example.ex: ...the country's rich deposits of the metal, lithium.
example.tran: 这个国家丰富的锂金属矿藏

example.ex: ...the richness of the country's mineral deposits.
example.tran: 该国丰富的矿藏

value.def: If you say that something is a rich vein or source of something such as humour, ideas, or information, you mean that it can provide a lot of that thing.

example.ex: The director discovered a rich vein of sentimentality...
example.tran: 导演发现了一个丰富的情感源泉。

example.ex: My collection of Victorian literature turned out to be a rich and often hilarious source of information.
example.tran: 我收藏的维多利亚时代的文学作品竟成了一个资源丰富的信息宝库，而且内容常常令人捧腹。

value.tran: 充满（幽默感、创意等）的;（信息）丰富的

value.def: Rich smells are strong and very pleasant. Rich colours and sounds are deep and very pleasant.

example.ex: ...a rich and luxuriously perfumed bath essence.
example.tran: 香味浓郁的沐浴香精

example.ex: ...an attractive, glossy rich red colour.
example.tran: 迷人而富有光泽的艳红色

value.tran: (气味)浓郁的，香浓的;(颜色)浓艳的，强烈的，鲜艳的;（声音）低沉的，浑厚的

example.ex: ...the richness of colour in Gauguin's paintings.
example.tran: 高更画作中绚丽的颜色

value.def: A rich life or history is one that is interesting because it is full of different events and activities.

example.ex: A rich and varied cultural life is essential for this couple.
example.tran: 丰富多样的文化生活对这对夫妇而言至关重要。

example.ex: ...the rich history of the island...
example.tran: 这个岛屿灿烂的历史

example.ex: Manchester has a rich cultural, economic and sporting heritage.
example.tran: 曼彻斯特有丰富的文化、经济和体育遗产。

example.ex: It all adds to the richness of human life.
example.tran: 这一切让人类的生活更加丰富多彩。

value.def: A rich collection or mixture contains a wide and interesting variety of different things.

example.ex: Visitors can view a rich and colorful array of aquatic plants and animals...
example.tran: 游客们可以看到一系列各种各样、色彩斑斓的水生动植物。

example.ex: Australia has a rich cultural mix.
example.tran: 澳大利亚拥有丰富多样的文化。

example.ex: ...a rich vocabulary.
example.tran: 大量的词汇

value.tran: (收藏或混合物)丰富的，各种各样的

example.ex: ...a huge country, containing a richness of culture and diversity of landscape.
example.tran: 拥有丰富的文化和复杂多样的地貌的大国

value.def: If you say that something a person says or does is rich, you are making fun of it because you think it is a surprising and inappropriate thing for them to say or do.

example.ex: Gil says that women can't keep secrets. That's rich, coming from him, the professional sneak.
example.tran: 吉尔说女人不能保守秘密。这话从他这样一个整天打小报告的人嘴里说出来真是太荒谬了。

value.tran: 不合情理的;荒谬的;荒唐的

value.def: If you say that someone is filthy rich or stinking rich, you disapprove of them because they have a lot of money.

example.ex: He's stinking rich, and with no more talent than he ever had before.
example.tran: 他现在已经有几个臭钱了，但仍然和以前一样没什么才能。

example.ex: ...a handful of filthy rich young men who work eight months a year.
example.tran: 少数几个每年只工作8个月的腰缠万贯的年轻人

trans: 富矿,好矿；富矿；好矿；富矿石
富媒体；富媒体广告；丰富媒体；多元媒体；超媒体
